    • Constructor Detail

      • PingballServer

        public PingballServer(int port)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Make a PingballServer that listens for connections on port.
        Parameters:
        port - port number, requires 0 <= port <= 65535
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • serve

        public void serve()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Run the server, listening for client connections and handling them. Never returns unless an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the main server socket is broken (IOExceptions from individual clients do *not* terminate serve())

      • handleConnection

        private void handleConnection(java.net.Socket socket)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Handle multiple client connections. Returns when all client disconnect.
        Parameters:
        socket - socket where the client is connected
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if connection has an error or terminates unexpectedly

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Start a PingballServer using the given arguments. Usage: PingballServer [--host HOST] [--port PORT] FILE
        Parameters:
        args - argument provided by user (optional host, optional port, filename)

      • runPingballServer

        public static void runPingballServer(java.io.File file,
                     int port)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Start a PingballServer running on the specified port, with a board loaded from a file.
        Parameters:
        file - Start with a board loaded from the specified file, according to the input file format defined in the pingball spec.
        port - The network port on which the server should listen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
